intro: Operculina sericantha, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has a fibrous root system and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
